Docs.param: The simple type that defines the units of measurement of the offset.
The degree of granularity of the in fractions of a second, based on the number of decimal places supported. For example a precision of 3 means the granularity supported is milliseconds.
Docs.summary: Creates a object of the type that the parameters describe.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage CreateDefaultTypeUsage (System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmType edmType);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage CreateDefaultTypeUsage(class System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmType edmType) cil managed

Docs.param: A for which the object is created.
Docs.summary: Creates a object with the specified conceptual model type.
Docs.returns: A object with the default facet values for the specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmType> is a primitive type, such as `String`, `Decimal`, `Binary` or `DateTime`, this method invokes one of the corresponding methods declared in the <xref:System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage> class. Otherwise, it creates a <xref:System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage> object with the specified <xref:System.Data.Metadata.Edm.EdmType> directly.
